content: Can someone cite quality studies that show that gender reassignment surgeries improve mental health? Mayo did an evaluation of multiple studies to find: “Very low quality evidence suggests that sex reassignment that includes hormonal interventions in individuals with GID likely improves gender dysphoria, psychological functioning and comorbidities, sexual function and overall quality of life.” This doesn’t seem like the kind of data that would support GRS as a means for treating GID. Of the independent studies I’ve read they typically seem to be observational, involve low samples (usually between 5–30 people), and tend to lack controls. Here are some studies in the affirmation: NCBI Springer Hindawi EuropePMC To put medical coverage in perspective consider whether we should cover breast implants because recipients/studies report improved mental health?
